title: How to Quickly Open the Launchpad on a Mac

steps.title: Press .
steps.content: Press . F4 . This is the default shortcut for Launchpad on most newer Macs. If this doesn't work try, Fn + F4 .

steps.title: Place three fingers in the top-right corner of the trackpad.
steps.content: Place three fingers in the top-right corner of the trackpad. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Place your thumb in the bottom-left corner.
steps.content: Place your thumb in the bottom-left corner.

steps.title: Pinch your thumb and three fingers together.
steps.content: Pinch your thumb and three fingers together. Make sure all four digits make contact with the trackpad as you pinch. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Enable the gesture if it was disabled.
steps.content: Enable the gesture if it was disabled. You can enable this gesture from the System Preferences menu: Click the Apple menu and select System Preferences. Click the Trackpad option. Click the More Gestures tab. Check the Launchpad box.

steps.title: Click the Apple menu.
steps.content: Click the Apple menu. You can set your own shortcut to open the Launchpad as well. Click the Apple menu in the upper-left corner of the screen.

steps.title: Click System Preferences.
steps.content: Click System Preferences . If the main System Preferences menu does not appear, click Show All. This button has a grid with 12 dots on it.

steps.title: Click Keyboard.
steps.content: Click Keyboard . This is in the second section.

steps.title: Click the Shortcuts tab.
steps.content: Click the Shortcuts tab.

steps.title: Click the Launchpad & Dock option.
steps.content: Click the Launchpad & Dock option.

steps.title: Click the Show Launchpad box to enable it.
steps.content: Click the Show Launchpad box to enable it.

steps.title: Press the key or combination you want to use.
steps.content: Press the key or combination you want to use.

steps.title: Press your new shortcut to open Launchpad.
steps.content: Press your new shortcut to open Launchpad .

steps.title: Click the Apple menu.
steps.content: Click the Apple menu. You can turn on the Hot Corners feature, which will allow you to start Launchpad by moving your mouse into a corner of your screen.

steps.title: Click System Preferences.
steps.content: Click System Preferences .

steps.title: Click Desktop & Screen Saver.
steps.content: Click Desktop & Screen Saver . This is in the first row of options.

steps.title: Click the Screen Saver tab.
steps.content: Click the Screen Saver tab.

steps.title: Click Hot Corners.
steps.content: Click Hot Corners . This button is in the lower-right corner.

steps.title: Click the menu for the corner you want to activate.
steps.content: Click the menu for the corner you want to activate. Each menu corresponds to one of your screen corners.

steps.title: Click Launchpad.
steps.content: Click Launchpad .

steps.title: Move your mouse to the corner to open Launchpad.
steps.content: Move your mouse to the corner to open Launchpad. Launchpad will open when your cursor is in the corner.
